title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". Congress emphasizes the obligation of federal agencies to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which set a Government-wide goal of awarding at least 3 percent of contracts to service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses each fiscal year. Progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans has been slow. Prime contractors and Executive departments have an obligation to contribute to meeting this goal, and the public has a right to know if they are meeting it. SEC. 3. Transparency in contracting goals for small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. This includes definitions for 'covered contractor' and 'Executive department'. Reports to the administrator are required three months after. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report the percentage of contracts awarded to these businesses quarterly. The Executive department awards contracts to covered contractors, specifying percentage goals for subcontracting to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. If the contract is completed within a 3-month period, the report includes the percentage of total contract value. The report includes the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the negotiated percentage goal for subcontracting to these businesses for all contracts awarded by the Executive department. The report includes the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans for contracts awarded by the Executive department. The Administrator will rank contractors based on subcontracting to these businesses. The Administrator will rank Executive departments based on the percentage of contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. This includes both prime contracts and subcontracts awarded by covered contractors. The Administrator will rank Executive departments based on the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, and publish a user-friendly report on a website accessible to the public. The Administrator will publish a report on a website containing information submitted by Executive departments and rankings made by the Administrator, with an exception for national security concerns. The Administrator will update the website quarterly with information from Executive departments. Additionally, an annual report on progress towards Government-wide contracting goals will be submitted to Congress. The report shall include a statement on the website's data accuracy and a recommendation for a prime contractor recognized for contracting with small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. The report shall include a statement on the website's data accuracy and a recommendation for a prime contractor recognized for contracting with small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Nothing in this subsection may be construed to affect any other reporting requirement under Federal law.
